title: Bruiser Kassadin
body:
I know that it is standard that Kassadin is played AP, but I like breaking the meta. So i was trying bruiser. Tell me what you think in the comments.

{{champion:38}}  {{item:3078}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3053}}{{item:3009}} {{item:3742}} + a countering tank item
Taking Grasp of the Undying as the keystone.
Taking Ignite and Teleport as summoners.

Will provide a replay in a few hours.

Edit: Replay will be from LSI. Dunno how compatibility works, so just a warning.

Edit 2: Here is the link (Dropbox, tell me if there is something better) https://www.dropbox.com/s/r668ahgyndqw7mq/replay_1452192576_EUNE.lrf?dl=0

Edit 3: Match history link to the match in replay: http://matchhistory.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUN1/1452192576/209217362?tab=overview

replies.body:
When you mentioned a countering tank item I was like "But there's 6 items already there?!?!"

{{champion:38}} is not an item.
Is that very distracting that I should remove it or is it K?
Wonder why some champions don't have Duo scaling values on at least 1 ability. Kass W makes it perfect candidate for both  AD and AP scaling in single ability since it benefits his basic attacks
Well he was made in mind as an AP assassin. Why would he have an AD ratio?
Why would ashe have an AP ratio on her ult? The world may never know.
Isn't that connected a little to the Baron buff? A rioter sad that Jhin (and maybe a few others as well) had AP ratios so the AP part of the buff wouldn't feel useless. Perhaps it is connected?
And that is probably why kass should have some sort of ad ratio, because baron gives some ad too. Also i'm a fan of those kind of things because that's how fun off builds are found.
AD is kinda activated on basic attacks, so... Go on?
But my would my AD Kat do without her AD ratios on her w and r?!
Then you would have misspelled AP.

> [{quoted}](name=FormationX,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-06-27T22:56:38.477+0000)
>
> Well he was made in mind as an AP assassin. Why would he have an AD ratio?

as far as i know he was reworked AS an AP assassin. Originally he was just an antimage; a fighter who was designed to silence mages and steal mana.
Good points which i cannot counter.

Seems like you wouldn't have much mana. But maybe you're not planning on Rift Walking a bunch?  

I'm curious to see the results.
Agreed, I'd take a gauntlet over trinity and maybe frozen heart instead of deadmans.

> [{quoted}](name=Red Rengo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2016-06-27T22:44:52.157+0000)
>
> Agreed, I'd take a gauntlet over trinity and maybe frozen heart instead of deadmans.

You need Trinity over Gaunlet for the damage. Kassadin doesn't have AD scaling spells or high base damages so he needs higher damage AD items/CDR so he can spam riftwalk and keep his E charged for sticking power. And the 200% Trinity proc will be much more damage than the 100% Iceborn proc will and since you build CDR, you're basically going to proc Trinity every 1.5-2 seconds.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sotere,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-06-27T22:35:01.461+0000)
>
> Seems like you wouldn't have much mana. But maybe you're not planning on Rift Walking a bunch?  
> 
> I'm curious to see the results.

Its actually a better build than AP kass. 
Ive done it before - not with titanic hydra and gauge, i used maw and spirit visage  - and its very effective for a skirmisher playstyle. 

You dont really need much mana as AD kass, your W fills all your mana needs and  Q-- > R --> AA --> W --> E --> Fight until they run away or they win the engagement --> R out to safety/R in for the kill. 

Warmogs makes a fantastic last item because it lets you reset to go back in later without going back. Spirit visage is also very useful if they have a lot of AP on their team.
Could be, but I think that it gives way too much damage so it can be replaced. Mana isn't a problem usually, since if you would die, you die. Ult ain't helping you.

{{champion:38}} {{item:3042}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3742}} 

This build actually works, I know a dude who got diamond doing it. The mana is the key aspect because it makes riftwalk still chunk while you have good sustained and moderate burst with Trinity procs + gunblade and its active. You're not SUPER durable but kassadin is so slippery that this build makes you beefy enough. The downside is it takes some time and levels to get going, not to mention its some expensive itemization.
I would like to know more...
I wouldn't say playing Tankadin is breaking the meta considering Tankko and Fish Tank are meta as fuck

> [{quoted}](name=Dies to Wolves,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2016-06-28T03:04:26.148+0000)
>
> I wouldn't say playing Tankadin is breaking the meta considering Tankko and Fish Tank are meta as fuck

... tanks are not bruisers.

> [{quoted}](name=Paroe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2016-06-28T03:10:13.370+0000)
>
> ... tanks are not bruisers.

The exact terminology in this case doesn't matter. They're assassins building tank or bruiser items rather than assassin (?) items. Doing it on a not-so-popular champion isn't breaking the meta, is adapting a not-so-popular champion to the meta.

> [{quoted}](name=Dies to Wolves,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=000b00000000,timestamp=2016-06-28T03:38:39.607+0000)
>
> The exact terminology in this case doesn't matter. They're assassins building tank or bruiser items rather than assassin (?) items. Doing it on a not-so-popular champion isn't breaking the meta, is adapting a not-so-popular champion to the meta.

Kassadin hasnt been a real assassin in a very long time. 
To be an assassin you have to;
A) Have base damage burst
B) Have scaling damage burst
C) Have to be mobile
D) Have to be safe from getting blown up yourself 

Kassadin hits ONE of those notes. He is mobile. 

Tank refers to HP/resistances where BRUISER refers to damage/HP. It just so happens the best in slot HP items have resistances. 
Because kassadin has one of the worst non-support base damages in the game and some of the worst scaling of non supports in the game, he cannot be called an assassin. He is just "a mid laner" and has been for years.

if bruiser is HP/damage
what is damage/resistances

> [{quoted}](name=Varus Vindicator,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=000b0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-09T00:14:29.200+0000)
>
> if bruiser is HP/damage
> what is damage/resistances

Damage/resistance is niche. 
theres only three items with that; two of them are AP and one of them is AD.

You could call them fighter items i suppose?
I ment a a full build of only damage and resistance, but fighter fits that too sence i only build that way on champs i build a lot of Life Steal on/have high in kit sustain.

i prefer frozenheart over deadmens, the aditional mana combined with your W allows to keep riftwalking as long as you stay in aa range, and 20% cdr are always nice.
Also, why boots of swiftness? You play a champ with 3sec base cd on a setp, you don't worry alot about slows or ms in general as kassa.
I'd also take fervor over grasp after all the grasp nerfs. Between his base as, ect runes and trinity, he gets quite some as to get alot more dps from fervor than grasp could ever give(you need ~3700 hp for grasp to deal as much damage as fervor, just that it's only every 4sec rather than every AA), and the healing on grasp really isn't much to speak of anymore.

Last time i played him as brusier, my built was {{item:3078}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3022}} {{item:3110}} {{item:3091}} {{item:3053}} , not as much burst as titanic gives, but more dps and great for catching poeople for your team with the mallet slow.
Perhaps you are correct about the keystone. But remember, I take swifties because of low Mana, so that I can atleast replace a blink or two with flat movement speed.

With FH+Trinity, you have enough mana that your W vs champs restores enough for a fully charged riftwalk(which deals good damage aswell), so ms isn't needed with that adaptation.
Tbh, i don't see why I would try to get artifical ms from deadmen's+swifties instead of mana/cdr when i have the most powerfull mobillity tool in league on my champ.

kassadin's base damage is so fucking low its not worth doing that. 
kassadin has the lowest base damages. of any mage. any mage. or maybe even any champion. dude go tank on annie u will do more damage.
bruiser kass is great until a real bruiser comes looking for trouble

Correct.

It is off-meta though.
Gauntlet is pretty mandatory for bruiser builds unless you want to have absolutely no mana.

What do you think about replaceing Tforce with muramana?
he has high mana costs for R and i think he has MP scailings. 
speeking of mp scalings, frozen heart?

i actually build bruiser {{champion:38}} , but AP bruiser:

{{item:3025}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3003}} {{item:3158}} {{item:3001}} +situational item

>
> Seems like you wouldn't have much mana. But maybe you're not planning on Rift Walking a bunch?  

 {{champion:38}}  without riftwalk is even more useless.
Mana Kass is fun. {{item:3027}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3110}}

> [{quoted}](name=BloodyTompon,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2016-06-28T03:47:40.162+0000)
>
> Mana Kass is fun. {{item:3027}} {{item:3070}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3110}}

was better when  {{item:3027}} gave 800 mana
Idk why you would do that, why not simply pick a champion that has more CC and that can abuse titanic hydra even harder? The only reason why I see people doing this is to have a mobile bruiser.

i used to do proxy kas

with {{item:3117}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3742}} 

just put the zZzrot somewhere then go farm behind enemy tower or in their base since you have this 2 sec flash and the mobi boots with deadmansplate you are quite uncatchable it pure troll really no one can get to you unless they use all 5 people and surround you and even then you can sometimes make it out regardless

if people chase you zzrot would take their turret if they dont well you are catching the minion wave before ti meets yours so their tower wittles away under the pressure

but this was like very long ago 

thought id post it in this antimeta kassadin thread

Why are you talking of {{champion:27}} ?

I get what you are saying though. Could work.

well it does work but it is kind of lame because you play ''outside'' of the game

you pretty much hard ignore everything and everyone and just keep the minions shoving in the enemy direction

its pretty toxic to have to deal with

everytime someone shows up you just run away with your ult and mobi boots

but this was a long time ago i think right now the build would be a bit different

Has anyone ever built frozen heart, iceborn gauntlet, seraph's embrace, muramana, and a ROA/MR item before? Because that, imo, is the most hilarious yet underrated build ever. 

That gives you over 3000 bonus mana. Your W will restore way more mana than your ult cost ;P

Seraph's embrace will shield you for over 1000.

And your ult HURTS.

Only flaw is how long it takes to stack.

Do notr that muramana procs twice on his w, for a total 12% of mana bonus damage, that is, 480 damage with just the items listed up there, not counting auto attack damage, iceborn damage, or his w's bonus damage.
I thought of going with both 1000 Mana items, but I thought it was overkill.

> [{quoted}](name=FormationX,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=WifkIzUj,comment-id=000c0000,timestamp=2016-06-28T06:28:44.162+0000)
>
> I thought of going with both 1000 Mana items, but I thought it was overkill.

It's pretty hypercarryish tbh. Delays your strength till late game, but when you get strong, you're REALLY strong.

I just don't think you should handi cap yourself like this X_X

In ranked* its gucci in normals.
gauntlet for mana?

Not really necessary.
Read further down.
